alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Chesterfield, west central Charles City, northwestern Prince George, south central Henrico and northern Dinwiddie Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 400 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Colonial Heights to near Sutherland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hopewell around 325 PM EDT. Jordans Point around 335 PM EDT. Virginia State University, Matoaca and Ettrick around 345 PM EDT. Petersburg and Colonial Heights around 350 PM EDT. Fort Lee and Prince George around 355 PM EDT. Garysville around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Burgess, Birchett Estate, Addison, Jordan Point Country Club, Petersburg National Battlefield, New Bohemia, Petersburg Airport, Church Road, Five Forks and Richard Bland College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico; Prince George
